revised_title: Examination of the Proximate Principles of Lichens: Part II
tldr: The author examines the proximate principles of various lichens, focusing on Gyrophora pustulata and Lecanora tartarea. They investigate the extraction and properties of the colorant compounds, known as gyrophoric acid and orcine, and their potential uses in the manufacture of archil, a natural dye. The author also discusses the nutritional value of these lichens, particularly in times of scarcity.
